msdps007 Redwing
Rarity: Super Rare
Looking for Inventory Management? Please Login w/ "Remember Me?" option selected.
Redwing
INDESTRUCTIBLE
EQUIP: Any
UNEQUIP: Drop
EFFECT: FREE: Once per game, generate a Redwing bystander. // FREE: Remove a Redwing Light Object held by this character from the game. If you do, this turn, this character may activate the FREE action to generate the Redwing Bystander regardless of the "Once per game" restriction.
Light Object
10 Points

BubbleBuster101
[QUOTE=Gen_Leo;12200897]I hope I have this right. It feels a little convoluted. There are three parts to this: 1) The 3d object this thread is for 2) The bystander token this object generates 3) The light object the token generates A character equips this object, either by starting with it or taking an action. They have the effect to generate the Redwing bystander once per game. They take the free action to generate the bystander. At this point they are still equipped with the 3d object and the bystander token is on the field. At some point the Redwing bystander takes damage and is knocked out. When it is knocked out, the Redwing light object is generated. Now the equipped character still has the 3d object and there is a light object, but no bystander. Later the equipped character picks up the light object. They are now equipped with the 3d object and carrying the light object. They can remove the light object from the game to generate a new bystander. At no point in this sequence did the character unequip the 3d object, so they never need to re-equip it.[/QUOTE] Thank you very much Gen_Leo! That was a good explanation and now I think I completely understand it. This one had me a little confused lol
June 18, 2022
Gensan
That is correct.
June 18, 2022
Gen_Leo
I hope I have this right. It feels a little convoluted. There are three parts to this: 1) The 3d object this thread is for 2) The bystander token this object generates 3) The light object the token generates A character equips this object, either by starting with it or taking an action. They have the effect to generate the Redwing bystander once per game. They take the free action to generate the bystander. At this point they are still equipped with the 3d object and the bystander token is on the field. At some point the Redwing bystander takes damage and is knocked out. When it is knocked out, the Redwing light object is generated. Now the equipped character still has the 3d object and there is a light object, but no bystander. Later the equipped character picks up the light object. They are now equipped with the 3d object and carrying the light object. They can remove the light object from the game to generate a new bystander. At no point in this sequence did the character unequip the 3d object, so they never need to re-equip it.

June 13, 2022
Gensan
Which is all a long-winded and overly-complicated way of saying that Goop is right. As long as you get to the object before your opponent each time Redwing is KO'd, you can keep generating one at a time.
June 13, 2022
Gensan
That's nonsense, Iron Elf, and completely inaccurate. The character equipped with Redwing (Equipment) is given a FREE action to generate Redwing (Bystander). There is no action to "REMOVE the Redwing (Bystander) Character A had previously generated". That doesn't exist. When the bystander is KO'd, you generate a Redwing (Light Object) in its square thanks to the effect on Redwing (Bystander). If the character equipped with Redwing (Equipment) is later holding the Redwing (Light Object) generated by Redwing (Bystander), they can activate the FREE action given by Redwing (Equipment) to remove it from the game and be given the option to generate another Redwing (Bystander) that turn, ignoring the Once Per Game restriction. If they do and the new Redwing (Bystander) is KO'd, its effect triggers again and another Redwing (Light Object) is generated. Then, once again, the character equipped with Redwing (Equipment) can activate the FREE action to remove that object from the game if they're holding it and be given the option to generate another Redwing (Bystander) that turn, ignoring the Once Per Game restriction.
June 12, 2022
Iron Elf
[B][I][U][COLOR="Red"]Actually, the Redwing (Bystander) works like this:[/COLOR][/U][/I][/B] When assigned to character A, Character A uses a FREE action to generate a Redwing (Bystander), then: [LIST] [*]If that Redwing (Bystander) is KO'd, then NO MORE Redwing (Bystander) s may be generated by Character A [B]for the rest of that game. [/B] [*]If Redwing is NOT KO'd, AND Character A uses a separate FREE action to REMOVE the Redwing (Bystander) Character A had previously generated, [B][I][U][COLOR="red"]then and ONLY then[/COLOR][/U][/I][/B] may Character A generate a future Redwing (Bystander). [/LIST] Only AFTER generating AND removing a Redwing (Bystander) is Character A able to ignore the once-per-game limitation. [B][COLOR="Black"] NOTE: only ONE Redwing (Bystander) may be generated per character assigned the Redwing (Bystander). [/COLOR][/B]
May 25, 2022
Thunderwebs
Comes with SR The Falcon 048.
May 3, 2022
Goop
Kind of complicated written but plays well. Although you can only generate him once, each time redwing dies you can pick up the light object left behind and give a free action to put him back into play. So as long as you get to the light object before your opponent does you can keep him coming back any number of times.
April 24, 2022
Artarus
No, only twice. You get the first one. Then you can generate a second Redwing BT by removing the object.
